intro: Eriostemon brucei subsp. brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive glandular surface. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or rainforest habitats. This subspecies is often found in the southeastern regions of Australia, including parts of New South Wales and Victoria.
